Gag clauses in healthcare contracts were a concern for TPAs and brokers.
Healthcare costs are high and individuals/organizations are looking for ways to save money.
Need for solutions to make healthcare more affordable for patients, plan members, payers/TPAs, benefits advisors/brokers, and employers.
Hospitals may not be applying 501(r) discounts, leading to higher patient bills.
Need for industry professionals (TPAs) to connect and learn about healthcare administration.

People go toe-to-toe with the healthcare system.
Our healthcare system doesn't exactly scream transparency.
No one can really give you a price estimate.
Medical records are filed away in dusty cabinets.
Concerns about not being charged fairly.
Lack of expertise to successfully negotiate hospital bills.
Facing a sea of charges on a medical bill that is not understood.
Coding errors on bills.
Inability to resolve billing issues on one's own.
Stressful negotiation with hospitals.
Outrageous charges for services (e.g., ER visits).
Facing large medical debt.
Hospitals being uncooperative and denying disputes.
Feeling hopeless about medical bills.
Stress from bills after significant life events (e.g., birth of a child).
Overcharging by hospitals.
Difficulty discovering billing errors independently.
Nearly every hospital bill is negotiable, but the process is stressful and time-consuming for individuals.
The standard bill received in the mail usually hides errors and inflated charges.
Patients may not have the expertise to review their medical record against their bill to flag suspicious charges.
The healthcare system lacks affordability, fairness, and transparency for patients.
Patients struggle to go 'toe-to-toe' with the healthcare system.
It's difficult to get price estimates for healthcare services.
Medical records are often inaccessible or filed away, making it hard for patients to access their own data.
Members and plan sponsors often miss out on 'hidden savings' because they are unaware of or struggle to access 501(r) discounts.
The process of securing 501(r) discounts can be complex, involving screening, application, and follow-up.
Plan sponsors and members may not be paying the 'right amount' on claims due to unapplied 501(r) discounts.
Many claims that are eligible for 501(r) discounts are not receiving them, as it's considered 'healthcare’s best-kept savings secret'.
The process of identifying eligibility, applying for, and securing 501(r) discounts can be complex and burdensome for individuals and plans.
Claims are often paid without considering potential discounts, leading to overpayment by plans and members.
Claims are often paid without considering potential discounts, leading to overpayment by plans and members.
Fulfilling fiduciary duty regarding healthcare costs can be challenging for plan sponsors.
Most hospital claims contain inflated charges.
5 in 10 claims contain coding errors or unnecessary care.
Clawback headaches from post-payment reviews.
Coding errors (upcoding, unbundling, duplicate charges, wrong quantities).
Clinically unnecessary care (inflated severity of condition, excessive labs or tests, low-value procedures).

recommendations: Ensure plans and members pay only what’s fair, with 501(r) discounts and pre-payment claim reviews.

Instant 501(r) discount eligibility screening.
Medical record retrieval in seconds.
Personal case manager available 7 days a week.

501(r), a financial assistance requirement at nonprofit hospitals, can lower both the plan and member responsibility.
4 in 10 claims eligible through our instant checks.
Plans can save up to 80% off billed charges.
Members save up to 100% off patient responsibility.
Improve claim review accuracy by cross-checking provider notes —before repricing, adjudication and payment.

Integrations with EHR platforms enable members to instantly grant access to visit data.
Reviews by licensed coders & clinicians.
We know members better than anyone else. After all, we started our company by helping patients first.
99 All-time CSAT Score.

Works with existing platforms and solutions.
Bilingual English and Spanish support.
Available 7 days a week by phone, email and chat.
We negotiate your hospital bills, too!
We review your bill for errors and negotiate to save you money.
Exceptional in terms of hospital bill audits and hospital bill reduction.

Great to have a watchdog on their side to ensure they are not overpaying.
Protect our clients and members from high hospital costs and take the stress out of hospital visits.

Delivering smarter savings and real financial protection.

Software – which draws on public hospital data – catches unnecessary tests and incorrect codes.
Goodbill is a great place to turn.
We maximize your savings.

issues: Our healthcare system doesn't exactly scream transparency.

Goodbill negotiates hospital bills for you.

issues: Concerns about not being charged fairly.
Lack of expertise to successfully negotiate hospital bills.
Facing a sea of charges on a medical bill that is not understood.
Coding errors on bills.
Inability to resolve billing issues on one's own.
Stressful negotiation with hospitals.
Outrageous charges for services (e.g., ER visits).
Facing large medical debt.
Hospitals being uncooperative and denying disputes.
Feeling hopeless about medical bills.
Stress from bills after significant life events (e.g., birth of a child).
Overcharging by hospitals.
Difficulty discovering billing errors independently.
recommendations: Goodbill negotiates hospital bills.
Goodbill provides case managers who keep in constant contact and are knowledgeable.
Goodbill reviews charges and advocates on behalf of the patient.
Goodbill identifies coding errors, leading to bills being waived or significantly reduced.
Goodbill makes the negotiation process easy and stress-free.
Goodbill is proactive, efficient, and easy to work with.
Goodbill helps reduce medical costs and takes care of the entire process.
Goodbill provides outstanding customer service, being efficient, professional, responsive, and patient.
Goodbill brings fairness and relief to challenging billing situations.
Goodbill handles the entire process, requiring minimal effort from the patient (e.g., uploading health records).

issues: Nearly every hospital bill is negotiable, but the process is stressful and time-consuming for individuals.
recommendations: Goodbill's experts know how to navigate the negotiation process to maximize savings.
Goodbill offers a guarantee: you pay only 20% of what you save.
There is no upfront cost for Goodbill's service.
There are no hidden fees.
The signup process is easy and quick.

issues: The standard bill received in the mail usually hides errors and inflated charges.
Patients may not have the expertise to review their medical record against their bill to flag suspicious charges.
recommendations: Goodbill obtains the correct itemized bill from your hospital.
Goodbill's team of medical coding and billing experts reviews your medical record against your bill to flag suspicious charges.
Goodbill negotiates your hospital bill to achieve the best possible savings, providing regular updates.

issues: The healthcare system lacks affordability, fairness, and transparency for patients.
Patients struggle to go 'toe-to-toe' with the healthcare system.

recommendations: Goodbill is on a mission to make healthcare affordable, fair, and transparent for patients.

Goodbill leverages recent government efforts to require insurance companies and hospitals to make data accessible online, enabling better advocacy for patients.

issues: Members and plan sponsors often miss out on 'hidden savings' because they are unaware of or struggle to access 501(r) discounts.

recommendations: Utilize Goodbill to guide members through the entire 501(r) discount process, from screening to application to results.

issues: Plan sponsors and members may not be paying the 'right amount' on claims due to unapplied 501(r) discounts.

recommendations: Leverage Goodbill to ensure correct payment by applying 501(r) discounts.
Educate oneself about 501(r) eligibility and potential savings by downloading Goodbill's whitepaper or case study.

recommendations: Use Goodbill's secure portal as a one-stop shop for plans and members to streamline the 501(r) discount process, including instant eligibility checks, application completion, and follow-up with hospitals.
